news.title: Housing sales fall 14% in 2025 across top cities, but value rises 6%: Anarock
news.para: The year 2025 marked a pivotal change for housing sales in major Indian metros, witnessing a 14% drop in the number of transactions. Interestingly, the total value of sold properties climbed by 6%, underscoring a flourishing demand for upscale real estate. Meanwhile, the supply of new housing remained steady with a spike in luxury launches.

news.title: Odisha: Education minister distributes PMAY-U work orders in Sambalpur
news.para: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan distributed work orders for 855 houses under PMAY (Urban) in Sambalpur, a significant step for inclusive urban development. Beneficiaries also received aid under the Madhu Babu Pension Yojana at a program attended by state ministers and local officials.

news.title: Jaipur: Illegal constructions removed from Hawa Mahal-Amber zone
news.para: The Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) conducted a demolition drive against illegal constructions on government land in the Hawa Mahal-Amber zone. Nearly 4 bighas of JMC land were cleared in Kalalon Ki Dhani after demarcation confirmed encroachment. Further unauthorized constructions were also removed in Chandrashekhar Azad Colony.

news.title: Noida Metro Rail Corporation offers commercial space at three metro stations
news.para: Noida Metro Rail Corporation is leasing commercial spaces at Sector 81, Sector 83, and Depot metro stations on the Aqua Line to boost non-fare box revenue. Applications are due by January 5, 2026, with a 15-year license period. This initiative supports NMRC's financial strategy as ridership stands at 68,869 daily passengers.

news.title: IT investment push lifts Visakhapatnam development body's plot prices by 60%
news.para: Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority (VMRDA) plot auctions surged significantly, reflecting strong real estate demand fueled by substantial IT and digital infrastructure investments.  Palavalasa and Kapuluppada layouts saw bids exceeding upset prices by up to 64% and 47% respectively, driven by upcoming tech hubs and infrastructure projects.

news.title: KHB invites applications for new residential layout in Chamarajanagar
news.para: Karnataka Housing Board is developing its fourth residential layout in Chamarajanagar near Uttuvalli on a public-private partnership basis. The KHB has initiated a demand survey for the 24-acre project, offering sites for various income groups with a fixed rate of Rs 1,500 per square foot. Applications are being accepted online until December 31.

news.title: Over 380 buildings get Ahmedabad civic body's notices over unauthorised parking
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has issued 384 notices to buildings for illegal parking on public roads, footpaths, and other public spaces. Officials stated that many buildings lack adequate parking arrangements, causing significant traffic disruptions. Buildings are now mandated to install signage, create proper parking, and clear obstructions to utilize open spaces for parking.

news.title: Gujarat RERA takes steps for faster grievance redressal
news.para: GujRERA has launched a new digital-first SOP for faster property dispute resolution. Buyers can now file complaints online from home, with physical submission required within seven days. Uploading all documents upfront and direct review by the RERA secretary aim to cut delays.

news.title: Ghaziabad: 20 years on, GDA set to pay ₹45 crore to GMC for Swarn Jyantipuram handover
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority is finally transferring Swarn Jyantipuram to the Municipal Corporation after a 20-year delay, paying Rs 45 crore for pending infrastructure upgrades. This follows years of litigation and disagreements. The move aims to standardize handover processes, with residents of the 1,553-plot township set to benefit from improved amenities.

news.title: Aadhaar verification glitch stalls property, rent registration in Maharashtra
news.para: A five-day Aadhaar authentication glitch has halted property and rental registrations across Maharashtra, forcing applicants to visit offices with witnesses. The technical snag has crippled e-registrations, particularly for new flats in Pune and Mumbai, where biometric verification is mandatory. Officials are working with UIDAI to restore services and explore alternative verification methods.

news.title: Amaravati real estate on revival path, but affordability remains a concern
news.para: Andhra Pradesh's capital region, Amaravati, is experiencing a strong real estate revival heading into 2026, driven by accelerated infrastructure development and policy clarity.  The Outer Ring Road approval and second phase of land pooling have significantly boosted investor confidence and land values, though affordability remains a concern for middle-class buyers.

news.title: Real estate developers in Mumbai to wait out civic polls
news.para: Mumbai real estate developers are pausing project approvals and amendments. The municipal election code of conduct is causing administrative delays. Developers are prioritising ongoing projects. New launches and expansions are being staggered. This cautious approach is typical during election periods.

news.title: NBCC India and Delhi government settle Ghitorni land dispute
news.para: NBCC and the Delhi government have resolved a protracted land dispute concerning the 42.46-acre Sultanpur-Ghitorni parcel. They will divide the land equally, with NBCC compensating ₹150 crore plus ground rent for its share. This agreement not only clears the path for development but also opens potential revenue streams estimated at ₹8,500 crore.

news.title: Delhi civic body plans more C&D dumping sites with CCTV coverage, mist spraying system
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi is ramping up its waste management initiatives. The city will soon introduce fourteen new sites dedicated to construction and demolition waste, each equipped with cutting-edge CCTV surveillance and mist spray systems to curb dust pollution.

news.title: Real estate developer in Rajasthan accuses government officials of altering land ownership
news.para: A developer based in Jaipur has raised alarms over alleged misconduct by Jaipur Development Authority officials, accusing them of manipulating land records. The firm points to a suspicious alteration of ownership linked to a property acquired in 2005, claiming that a counterfeit document facilitated this unauthorized action.

news.title: Gross asset value of REITs to rise 35-40% by the end of next fiscal: Crisil
news.para: Indian REITs are on the brink of a remarkable transformation. Projections indicate a surge in asset values by 35-40% by fiscal 2027, driven by the acquisition of additional properties and the introduction of new REITs into the marketplace. Rising occupancy rates are set to enhance rental income, contributing to a robust financial backbone.

news.title: Ludhiana development body seals five unauthorized buildings in Threke village
news.para: Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (Glada) has sealed five unauthorized buildings in Threke village following notices to developers. Glada is adopting a zero-tolerance approach against illegal constructions and has recommended filing FIRs. Residents are urged to verify approved colonies on the Glada website before purchasing property.

news.title: Delhi government to map all land assets online
news.para: Delhi government is directing all land-owning departments to urgently submit property details for a centralized online database, DAMIS. This initiative aims to strengthen management, prevent encroachments, and create a reliable digital inventory of government assets for better planning and utilization.

news.title: Gmada flags 154 illegal constructions in Mohali
news.para: Gmada has identified 154 unauthorized constructions and submitted an action taken report to the National Green Tribunal.  Notices were issued and action initiated under relevant acts for illegal constructions detected in villages near the Chandigarh boundary. Gmada assured continuous monitoring and strict action against violators.

news.title: Gurugram: Illegal construction go unchecked in Sultanpur National Park buffer zone
news.para: Surveys have identified 232 unauthorized constructions within Sultanpur National Park's eco-sensitive zone and regulated corridors, violating development restrictions. These illegal structures threaten the Ramsar-recognized wetland, a crucial birdwatching site and part of the Central Asian Flyway. Authorities have issued show-cause notices, warning of demolition if non-compliance continues.
